TEXT: e1: One can hardly move in Friedrichshain or Neukoelln these days without permanently scanning the ground for dog dirt.
CN RELATION: ground, scanned for dog dirt (ReceivesAction)/dog dirt, ground (AtLocation)/dog dirt, Friedrichshain (AtLocation)/dog dirt, Neukoelln (AtLocation)/move, scanning for dog dirt (HasPrerequisite)

TEXT: e2: And when bad luck does strike and you step into one of the many 'land mines' you have to painstakingly scrape the remains off your soles.
CN RELATION: land mines, scrape the remains off your soles (Causes)/land mines, scraped off your soles (ReceivesAction)

TEXT: e3: Higher fines are therefore the right measure against negligent, lazy or simply thoughtless dog owners.
CN RELATION: higher fines, right measure (IsA)/dog owners, negligent (HasProperty)/dog owners, lazy (HasProperty)/dog owners, thoughtless (HasProperty)/dog owners, higher fines (Causes)

TEXT: e4: Of course, first they'd actually need to be caught in the act by public order officers,
CN RELATION: public order officers, catch in the act (CapableOf)

TEXT: e5: but once they have to dig into their pockets, their laziness will sure vanish!
